title: Textile, 1973-65-3, 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton, silk  
Technique: warp-faced plain weave
provenance: Dr. Mattiebelle Gittinger collected this in Nigeria in 1973.
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 45.7 x 12.1 cm (18 x 4 3/4 in.)
description: A narrow buff-colored band with a single narrow off-white stripe in the center, of a type called "sanyan." The warps are of wild silk and ivory cotton, and the wefts are of ivory cotton.
